alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued December 15 at 3:04PM EST until December 15 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Additional ice accumulation of one to two tenths above 2,000 feet with little or no additional ice accumulation elsewhere. Total ice accumulations will range from a tenth to a quarter inch below 2,000 feet with a half to three quarters of an inch above 2,000 feet. Total sleet accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Potomac Highlands of Virginia and West Virginia, Shenandoah Valley of Virginia, and the Blue Ridge Mountains. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Dangerous travel conditions will impact this evening`s commute. Some closures are possible along major area roadways, including Interstates 81 and 64. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Warmer air will continue into the valleys this afternoon, but freezing rain likely continues along the ridges into this evening.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
